content.text:
# Create Pull Request

Based on the `Instructions` below, take the `Variables` follow the `Run` section to create a pull request. Then follow the `Report` section to report the results of your work.

## Variables

branch_name: $1
issue: $2
plan_file: $3
adw_id: $4

## Instructions

- Generate a pull request title in the format: `<issue_type>: #<issue_number> - <issue_title>`
- The PR body should include:
  - A summary section with the issue context
  - Link to the implementation plan file
  - Reference to the issue (Closes #<issue_number>)
  - ADW tracking ID
  - A checklist of what was done
  - A summary of key changes made
- Extract issue number, type, and title from the issue JSON
- Examples of PR titles:
  - `feat: #123 - Add user authentication`
  - `bug: #456 - Fix login validation error`
  - `chore: #789 - Update dependencies`

## Run

1. Run `git diff origin/main...HEAD --stat` to see a summary of changed files
2. Run `git log origin/main..HEAD --oneline` to see the commits that will be included
3. Run `git diff origin/main...HEAD --name-only` to get a list of changed files
4. Run `git push -u origin <branch_name>` to push the branch
5. Set GH_TOKEN environment variable from GITHUB_PAT if available, then run `gh pr create --title "<pr_title>" --body "<pr_body>" --base main` to create the PR
6. Capture the PR URL from the output

## Report

Return ONLY the PR URL that was created (no other text)

ARGUMENTS: feature-8-8adf7635-edit-delete-task {"number":8,"title":"Add option to edit and delete task","body":"/feature\n\nAdd an icon (pencil) in the task card to edit the task. It will show the same creation modal, but with edit capabilities.\n\nAdd icon (trash can) to delete the task. Show a confirmation message before deleting the task.","state":"OPEN","author":{"id":"MDQ6VXNlcjYzNzk5MTg0","login":"juan-calou","name":"Juan Calou","is_bot":false},"assignees":[],"labels":[],"milestone":null,"comments":[],"createdAt":"2026-01-21T14:28:03Z","updatedAt":"2026-01-21T14:28:03Z","closedAt":null,"url":"https://github.com/juan-calou/tac-week-planner/issues/8"} specs/feature-8-edit-delete-task.md 8adf7635
I'll create a pull request for the edit and delete task feature.

input.command:
if [ ! -z "$GITHUB_PAT" ]; then export GH_TOKEN="$GITHUB_PAT"; fi && gh pr create --title "feature: #8 - Add option to edit and delete task" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

This PR implements the ability to edit and delete tasks in the week planner application, as requested in issue #8.

## Implementation Plan

See [specs/feature-8-edit-delete-task.md](specs/feature-8-edit-delete-task.md) for the full implementation plan.

## Changes Made

- Added edit icon (pencil) to each task card that opens the task creation modal in edit mode
- Added delete icon (trash can) to each task card with confirmation dialog before deletion
- Implemented `updateTask()` method in TaskService for updating existing tasks
- Enhanced the task modal to support both creation and editing modes
- Added confirmation dialog for task deletion with proper styling
- Updated task card layout to include action buttons while maintaining visual consistency

## Key Files Modified

- `app/client/src/app/app.component.ts` - Added edit/delete functionality and modal state management
- `app/client/src/app/app.component.html` - Added edit/delete buttons to task cards and confirmation dialog
- `app/client/src/app/app.component.css` - Styled action buttons and confirmation dialog
- `app/client/src/app/services/task.service.ts` - Added updateTask() method

Closes #8

ADW ID: 8adf7635
EOF
)" --base main
